critique: This document primarily deals with setting the rates of basic pay and salaries for various government employees, including those in the statutory pay systems, senior executive service, uniformed services, and other positions. It also addresses locality-based comparability payments. There is nothing about immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It does not seem to expand executive power, but rather implements existing laws. It does not obviously favor state or federal primacy. It does not deregulate or intervene in the economy beyond setting pay scales for government employees. It does not obviously lean liberal or conservative.
